title: Proposes an amendment to the constitution relating to equal pay for equal work
summary: Proposes an amendment to article 1 of the constitution relating to equal pay for equal work; provides that all employees shall receive equal pay for equal work of comparable value, skill, effort and responsibility that is performed under similar working conditions.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          417

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sens.  KRUEGER, DUANE, PARKER, SERRANO, STAVISKY -- read
         twice and ordered printed, and when printed to  be  committed  to  the
         Committee on Judiciary

                   CONCURRENT RESOLUTION OF THE SENATE AND ASSEMBLY

       proposing  an amendment to article 1 of the constitution, in relation to
         equal pay for equal work

    1    Section 1. Resolved (if the Assembly concur), That article  1  of  the
    2  constitution be amended by adding a new section 17-a to read as follows:
    3    S 17-A. ALL EMPLOYEES SHALL RECEIVE EQUAL PAY FOR EQUAL WORK OF COMPA-
    4  RABLE  VALUE,  SKILL, EFFORT, AND RESPONSIBILITY PERFORMED UNDER SIMILAR
    5  WORKING CONDITIONS.  THE PRINCIPLE OF EQUAL PAY FOR EQUAL WORK OF COMPA-
    6  RABLE VALUE REQUIRES THAT CONSIDERATION OF SEX, RACE OR NATIONAL  ORIGIN
    7  SHALL NOT INFLUENCE DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY THE ESTABLISHMENT OF WAGES OR
    8  SALARIES.
    9    S  2.  Resolved (if the Assembly concur), That the foregoing amendment
   10  be referred to the first regular legislative session convening after the
   11  next succeeding general election of members of  the  assembly,  and,  in
   12  conformity  with  section  1  of  article  19  of  the  constitution, be
   13  published for 3 months previous to the time of such election.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD89015-01-1
actClause: Concurrent Resolution of the Senate and Assembly proposing an amendment to article 1 of the constitution, in relation to equal pay for equal work
